titleInfo.title: (PC) Jamison v. Palagummi, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER DIRECTING MONTHLY PAYMENTS be made from Prison Account of Jeremy Jamison signed by Magistrate Judge Allison Claire on 10/17/13. CDC is to collect payments from plaintiff's account and forward to the clerk until the $350.00 filing fee is paid in full. Clerk to serve this order and a copy of plaintiff's IFP on the Director of CDC. Clerk to also serve Financial with a copy of this order. (cc: CDC Director and Financial)(Plummer, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Jamison v. Palagummi, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER AND FINDINGS and RECOMMENDATIONS signed by Magistrate Judge Allison Claire on 11/15/2013 DENYING plaintiff's 14 request for counsel; and the Clerk shall randomly assign this case to a district judge; and RECOMMENDING that plainitff's 14 motion for preliminary injunction be denied without prejudice. Assigned and Referred to Judge Troy L. Nunley; Objections due within 21 days. (Yin, K)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Jamison v. Palagummi, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Allison Claire on 3/10/2014 STRIKING plaintiff's 26, 31, 33 motions for summary judgment from the court's docket as premature and procedurally deficient; this order is without prejudice to the filing of a summary judgment that complies with the applicable rules and is filed after the close of discovery. (Yin, K)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Jamison v. Palagummi, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER and AMENDED DISCOVERY AND SCHEDULING ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Allison Claire on 04/22/14 vacating 35 defendant's motion to dismiss. Defendant may, within 14 days, bring a motion for summary judgment pursuant to FRCP 56 on the issue of administrative exhaustion. In doing so, defendant must provide plaintiff with the notice required under Rand v. Rowland. The discovery deadline is extended to 12/14/14. All pretrial motions, except motions to compel discovery, shall be filed on or before 04/01/15. (Plummer, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Jamison v. Palagummi, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Allison Claire on 11/04/14 ordering defendant's motion for summary judgment regarding exhaustion of administrative remedies 47 is granted to the extent it asserts that appeal 2095 is not exhausted and otherwise denied. Plaintiff's cross-motion for summary judgment regarding exhaustion of administrative remedies 53 is granted to the extent it asserts that exhaustion of appeal 1775 is excused, and otherwise denied. Accordingly, this lawsuit may proceed on plaintiff's claim that the defendant violated plaintiff's Eighth Amendment rights by (a) rescinding plaintiff's ADA status, (b) refusing to order needed surgery, (c) refusing to recommend plaintiff for a medical facility capable of handling his medical needs, and (d) refusing him needed pain management; and plaintiff's motion for a mail delivery order 46 is denied. (Plummer, M)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:13-cv-01705; (PC) Jamison v. Palagummi, et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California
extension.docketText: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Allison Claire on 11/04/14 ordering defendant's motion for summary judgment regarding exhaustion of administrative remedies 47 is granted to the extent it asserts that appeal 2095 is not exhausted and otherwise denied. Plaintiff's cross-motion for summary judgment regarding exhaustion of administrative remedies 53 is granted to the extent it asserts that exhaustion of appeal 1775 is excused, and otherwise denied. Accordingly, this lawsuit may proceed on plaintiff's claim that the defendant violated plaintiff's Eighth Amendment rights by (a) rescinding plaintiff's ADA status, (b) refusing to order needed surgery, (c) refusing to recommend plaintiff for a medical facility capable of handling his medical needs, and (d) refusing him needed pain management; and plaintiff's motion for a mail delivery order 46 is denied. (Plummer, M)

titleInfo.title: (PC) Jamison v. Palagummi, et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Allison Claire on 12/01/14 ordering within 14 days of the date of this order, defendant Dr. Palagummi must file a response to the plaintiff's emergency motions 63, 64, other than the request for appointment of counsel. The court construes those motions as motions for preliminary injunctive relief for an order directing the renewal of plaintiff's pain and seizure medication. There will be no extension of time granted for defendant's response. Plaintiff's motion for appointment of counsel 63 is denied without prejudice. Defendant's motion for clarification 60, construed as a motion for relief under Fed. R. Civ. P. 60(a) & (b) is denied. (Plummer, M)
